title: Barack Obama inaugurated as 44th President amidst deepening financial crisis.
Treasury Sec Geithner unveils Financial Stability Plan; markets drop 4% on lack of detail.
Obama signs $787 Billion ARRA Stimulus Act into law.
US government takes 36% equity stake in Citigroup to prevent failure.
S&P 500 hits intraday low of 666.79; marks the generational bottom of the GFC bear market.
Fed shocks markets: Announces purchase of $300B Treasuries and expands MBS buying to $1.25T (QE1 Expansion).
G20 Summit in London: Leaders agree to $1.1T global stimulus package; signals unified crisis response.
Stress Test Results: 10 of 19 banks need $75B capital; results 'better than feared' and ignite bank rally.
General Motors files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
FOMC Statement: Fed introduces 'extended period' language regarding low rates.
Fed notes economic activity has 'picked up' but unemployment remains concern.
Republican Scott Brown wins Ted Kennedy's Senate seat, jeopardizing healthcare reform legislation.
Obama signs Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) into law; healthcare stocks volatile.
S&P downgrades Greece to 'Junk' (BB+) and Portugal by two notches; contagion fears explode.
Eurozone/IMF agree to €110B Greek bailout package; demands severe austerity.
The Flash Crash: Dow plunges 998.5 points (9%) in minutes; Accenture trades at penny; markets recover by close.
EU announces €750B European Financial Stability Facility (EFSF) to defend the Euro.
Non-farm payrolls disappoint due to census hiring end; double-dip recession fears grow.
Obama signs Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act; mandates Volcker Rule and derivatives clearing.
Jackson Hole: Bernanke says Fed 'prepared to provide additional accommodation' (Hinting at QE2).
US Midterms: Republicans retake House in landslide; signals gridlock for remainder of Obama term.
Fed launches QE2: Will purchase $600B of Treasuries to lower long-term yields.
Tohoku Earthquake/Tsunami strikes Japan; Fukushima nuclear disaster halts global supply chains.
S&P puts US 'AAA' credit rating on negative outlook citing political gridlock.
Osama Bin Laden killed by US forces; geopolitical risk premium briefly dips.
Debt Ceiling Crisis ends: Budget Control Act passed hours before default; creates 'Sequester'.
ECB restarts bond buying program to support Italy and Spain yields.
S&P Downgrades US Credit Rating to AA+ from AAA; first time in history.
Black Monday 2011: Dow drops 634 points (5.5%) on downgrade fallout.
Fed FOMC: Pledges to keep rates low through 'mid-2013'; first explicit calendar guidance.
Swiss National Bank sets floor of 1.20 francs per euro to stop currency appreciation.
Fed announces 'Operation Twist': Swapping $400B short-term bonds for long-term to flatten curve.
MF Global files for bankruptcy after failed Eurozone debt bets.
Global Central Banks coordinate to slash dollar swap line rates; liquidity injection sparks rally.
S&P downgrades 9 Eurozone nations; France loses AAA status.
Hollande wins French election; Greek elections inconclusive; Euro breakup fears peak.
JPMorgan 'London Whale' trading loss revealed ($2B initially); bank stocks hit.
Supreme Court upholds Obamacare individual mandate as a tax.
Mario Draghi: 'Within our mandate, the ECB is ready to do whatever it takes to preserve the euro.'
ECB announces OMT: Unlimited bond-buying program for troubled sovereigns.
Fed announces QE3: Open-ended purchase of $40B MBS per month.
Obama re-elected; markets immediately focus on looming 'Fiscal Cliff' tax hikes.
Fed expands QE3: Adds $45B/month Treasuries (total $85B/month); sets 6.5% unemployment threshold.
Senate passes Fiscal Cliff deal (ATRA) averting recessionary tax hikes.
Cyprus Bailout: Deal includes unprecedented tax on bank deposits; gold plunges.
Gold crashes 9% (biggest drop in 30 years) on fears of central bank selling and Cyprus.
Bernanke Testimony: Says Fed could 'take a step down' in pacing purchases (Taper Tantrum begins).
Bernanke Presser: Lays out Taper roadmap to end QE by mid-2014; 10yr yield spikes to 2.5%.
NASDAQ flash freeze: Trading halted for 3 hours due to technical glitch.
Fed Surprise: No Taper. FOMC votes to maintain $85B/month pacing; markets rally hard.
US Government Shutdown begins (lasts 16 days) over funding dispute.
Twitter IPO: TWTR opens at $45.10, signaling return of tech euphoria.
The Taper Begins: Fed officially cuts monthly purchases by $10B to $75B; markets take it in stride.
Fed continues Taper: Reduces monthly bond purchases by $10B to $65B.
Janet Yellen sworn in as Fed Chair; first woman to lead the central bank.
Yellen's first FOMC: Drops 6.5% unemployment threshold; 'dots' plot signals rate hikes in 2015.
ECB cuts deposit rate to negative (-0.10%) for first time; launches targeted LTROs.
Scotland Independence Vote: Scots vote 'No' (55-45) to stay in UK; relief rally in Pound/FTSE.
Alibaba IPO: BABA opens massive; largest IPO in history at the time ($25B raised).
Treasury Flash Rally: 10-year yield plunges 34bps intraday on growth fears; market fragility exposed.
End of an Era: Fed concludes QE3 bond-buying program; keeps 'considerable time' rate language.
Bank of Japan shocks markets: Expands QQE stimulus significantly; Yen crashes.
OPEC Meeting: Saudi Arabia blocks production cuts despite crashing prices; Oil dives below $70 (start of Oil Depression).
Fed drops 'considerable time' phrase; replaces with 'patient' regarding rate hikes.
Swiss National Bank Shock: Unexpectedly unpegs Franc from Euro; CHF soars 30% in minutes; brokers blow up.
ECB launches full-blown QE: Will buy €60B bonds per month to fight deflation.
Fed removes 'patient' from statement; opens door for rate hikes data-dependent.
Shanghai Composite Bubble peaks at 5178; begins 40% crash over next two months.
Greek Referendum: Greeks vote 'No' to bailout terms; Grexit fears peak before eventual capitulation.
China Devaluation: PBOC surprisingly devalues Yuan (Renminbi) almost 2%; global panic ensues.
Black Monday 2015: Dow falls 1,000 points at open; VIX hits 53; AAPL halts trading; 'Flash Crash' in ETFs.
Fed holds rates steady: Cites 'Global economic and financial developments' (China/Market Volatility).
Glencore crashes 29% in one day; fears of commodity trader insolvency/Lehman moment.
Liftoff: Fed raises rates by 0.25% (0.25-0.50%); first hike since 2006; signals 4 hikes for 2016.
Worst New Year Start: China circuit breakers halt trading twice in a week; S&P 500 down 6%.
Bank of Japan adopts Negative Interest Rates (NIRP); markets react with confusion and volatility.
Oil Bottom: WTI Crude hits $26.21/barrel; fears of US energy bond defaults peak; markets bottom.
Fed Dovish Shift: Reduces 2016 hike forecast from 4 to 2 due to global risks; USD weakens.
Brexit Vote: UK shocks world voting to Leave EU; GBP crashes to 30-year low; Nikkei triggers circuit breaker.
BOJ announces 'Yield Curve Control': Pledges to pin 10yr JGB yield at 0%.
US Election Night: Trump lead causes S&P futures to hit limit down (-5%); Mexico Peso crashes.
The Trump Rally: Markets reverse losses to close up; focus shifts to deregulation, tax cuts, and infrastructure.
OPEC Deal: Cartel agrees to first output cut in 8 years; Oil rallies back toward $50.
Fed hikes rates to 0.50-0.75%; hawkish 'dot plot' forecasts 3 hikes in 2017.
Trump Inauguration: 'America First' speech; focus on trade protectionism starts.
Fed hikes rates to 0.75-1.00%; markets rally as hike was well-telegraphed.
Comey Memo/Mueller: Markets dip on political uncertainty; 'volatility selling' strategy dominates year.
Fed hikes rates to 1.00-1.25%; Yellen announces plan for Quantitative Tightening (QT).
Fed announces start of Balance Sheet Runoff (QT) in October; 'watching paint dry'.
Trump nominates Jerome Powell as next Fed Chair, replacing Yellen.
Bitcoin Futures launch on CBOE; Bitcoin hits $20k week later before crashing.
Fed hikes rates to 1.25-1.50%.
Tax Cuts and Jobs Act signed: Corporate tax rate slashed from 35% to 21%; massive earnings boost expected.
Trump imposes tariffs on solar panels (30%) and washing machines (20%); first protectionist shot fired.
Volmageddon: S&P drops 4%; VIX spikes 115% (record); XIV volatility note implodes; era of low vol ends.
Trump announces 25% tariff on steel and 10% on aluminum imports from all countries.
Trump targets China: Announces tariffs on $60B goods (Section 301) for IP theft; China vows retaliation.
US finalizes 25% tariffs on $50B Chinese goods; China retaliates in kind immediately.
Trade War Begins: US tariffs on $34B Chinese goods (List 1) go into effect.
Round 2: US imposes tariffs on $16B more Chinese goods (List 2); China matches.
Escalation: US announces 10% tariffs on $200B Chinese goods (List 3); rising to 25% on Jan 1.
Powell Error: Says rates are 'a long way from neutral'; 10yr yield breaks 3.20%; Tech stocks crash.
G20 Buenos Aires: Trump and Xi agree to 90-day truce; tariff hike paused.
Fed Hikes into Weakness: Raises rates to 2.25-2.50%; Powell says balance sheet runoff on 'autopilot'.
Christmas Eve Massacre: S&P 500 enters bear market (-20% from high); worst Christmas Eve trading ever.
The Powell Pivot: Powell walks back 'autopilot' comment; says Fed will be 'patient' and flexible.
Fed ends hiking cycle; announces plan to stop Balance Sheet runoff in September.
Trump Tweet: Threatens to raise tariffs on $200B goods to 25% immediately; truce broken.
Tech War: US places Huawei on 'Entity List'; bans sale of US chips/software to them.
Insurance Cut: Fed cuts rates 0.25% (first since 2008); Powell calls it 'mid-cycle adjustment'.
Trump tweets 10% tariff on remaining $300B Chinese imports (List 4) starting Sept 1.
Currency War: China halts ag purchases; Yuan falls below 7; US labels China 'Currency Manipulator'.
Inversion: 2yr/10yr yield curve inverts; classic recession signal triggers 800 point Dow drop.
Repo Crisis: Overnight repo rates spike to 10%; Fed forced to inject billions in liquidity.
Handshake Deal: Trump announces 'Phase One' trade deal reached in principle.
Fed cuts rates 0.25% (3rd cut); signals pause; liquidity injections ('Not QE') continue.
Phase One Agreement: Text finalized; Dec 15 tariffs cancelled; tariff rollbacks announced.
Signing Ceremony: US and China sign Phase One Trade Agreement at White House.
Wuhan Lockdown: China quarantines city of 11 million to contain novel coronavirus.
Market Top: S&P 500 hits all-time high of 3386 before virus reality sets in.
The Awakening: Dow drops 1,000 points on news of virus spread in Italy/Korea.
Emergency Cut: Fed slashes rates 0.50% between meetings; markets rally then fade.
Black Monday I: S&P 500 triggers Circuit Breaker (7% drop) at open; Oil crashes 24% on Saudi Price War.
Black Thursday: S&P 500 triggers Circuit Breaker again; Dow drops 10% (worst since 1987).
Fed 'All In': Sunday emergency cut to 0%; launches $700B QE; swap lines opened.
Black Monday II: Circuit Breaker triggered again despite Fed action; S&P falls 12%.
Liquidation: Bill Ackman 'Hell is coming' interview; panic selling in everything (Gold, Bonds, Stocks).
Unlimited QE: Fed announces open-ended bond buying; adds Corp Bond facilities (LQD/HYG).
The Bottom: S&P 500 closes at 2237; Fed backstop finally holds.
Stimulus: Trump signs $2.2 Trillion CARES Act; checks to households and PPP loans.
Main Street Lending: Fed unveils $2.3T in new loans; explicitly buys High Yield (Junk) bonds.
Negative Oil: WTI Crude futures expire at -$37.63 per barrel; chaos in energy markets.
Jackson Hole: Powell announces 'Average Inflation Targeting'; rates to stay lower for longer.
Softbank Whale: Tech stocks correct as massive options buying by Softbank is revealed.
Pfizer Vaccine: PFE announces 90% efficacy; 'Stay at Home' stocks crash, 'Reopen' stocks soar.
